019package org.tquadrat.foundation.util.stringconverter;
020
021import static java.time.format.SignStyle.NORMAL;
022import static java.time.temporal.ChronoField.YEAR;
023import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
025
026import java.io.Serial;
027import java.time.Year;
028import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
029import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatterBuilder;
030import java.time.format.DateTimeParseException;
031import java.util.Optional;
032
033import org.apiguardian.api.API;
034import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
035
036/**
037 *  The implementation of
038 *  {@link TimeDateStringConverter}
039 *  for {@code java.time.Year}.
040 *
041 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
042 *  @version $Id: YearStringConverter.java 1032 2022-04-10 17:27:44Z tquadrat $
043 *  @since 0.0.6
044 *
045 *  @UMLGraph.link
046 */
047@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: YearStringConverter.java 1032 2022-04-10 17:27:44Z tquadrat $" )
048@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.6" )
049public class YearStringConverter extends TimeDateStringConverter<Year>
050{
051        /*------------------------*\
052    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
053        \*------------------------*/
054    /**
055     *  The serial version UID for objects of this class: {@value}.
056     *
057     *  @hidden
058     */
059    @Serial
060    private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
061
062    /**
063     *  An instance of this class.
064     */
065    public static final YearStringConverter INSTANCE = new YearStringConverter();
066
067        /*--------------*\
068    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
069        \*--------------*/
070    /**
071     *  Creates a new {@code YearStringConverter} instance.
072     */
073    public YearStringConverter() { super( Year.class ); }
074
075    /**
076     *  Creates a new {@code YearStringConverter} instance.
077     *
078     *  @note The formatter may not drop any part of the temporal value,
079     *      otherwise
080     *      {@link #fromString(CharSequence)}
081     *      may fail. This means that the formatter is only allowed to re-order
082     *      the temporal fields.
083     *
084     *  @param  formatter   The formatter for the date/time data.
085     */
086    public YearStringConverter( final DateTimeFormatter formatter )
087    {
088        super( Year.class, formatter );
089    }   //  YearStringConverter()
090
091        /*---------*\
092    ====** Methods **==========================================================
093        \*---------*/
094    /**
095     *  {@inheritDoc}
096     */
097    @Override
098    protected final Year parseDateTime( final CharSequence source, final Optional<DateTimeFormatter> formatter ) throws DateTimeParseException
099    {
100        Year retValue = null;
101        if( nonNull( source ) )
102        {
103            /*
104             * We use Year.toString() when converting a Year to a String; this
105             * results in the String "-333" for the year of the Battle at
106             * Knossos.
107             * Unfortunately, the method Year.parse(CharSequence) will call
108             * internally the method Year.parse(CharSequence,DateTimeFormatter)
109             * with the internally defined instance PARSER as its second
110             * argument.
111             *
112             * PARSER is defined as below:
113             *    private static final DateTimeFormatter PARSER = new DateTimeFormatterBuilder()
114             *         .appendValue(YEAR, 4, 10, SignStyle.EXCEEDS_PAD)
115             *         .toFormatter();
116             *
117             * This will cause a DateTimeParseException for all years with less
118             * than four digits. Consequently, we have to define our own
119             * DateTimeFormatter when none was provided to the StringConverter.
120             *
121             * When constructing the DateTimeFormatter, a call to
122             * DateTimeFormatterBuilder.parseLenient() is required if we keep
123             * the SignStyle EXCEEDS_PAD, because no sign is printed for years
124             * after 0. We decided to use NORMAL instead, staying with strict
125             * parsing.
126             */
127            final var parser = formatter.orElseGet( () ->
128                new DateTimeFormatterBuilder()
129//                    .parseLenient()
130//                    .appendValue( YEAR, 1, 10, EXCEEDS_PAD )
131                    .appendValue( YEAR, 1, 10, NORMAL )
132                    .toFormatter() );
133            retValue = Year.parse( source, parser );
134        }
135
136        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
137        return retValue;
138    }   //  parseDateTime()
139
140    /**
141     *  This method is used by the
142     *  {@link java.util.ServiceLoader}
143     *  to obtain the instance for this
144     *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.StringConverter}
145     *  implementation.
146     *
147     *  @return The instance for this {@code StringConverter} implementation.
148     */
149    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
150    public static final YearStringConverter provider() { return INSTANCE; }
151}
152//  class YearStringConverter
153
154/*
155 *  End of File
156 */
